Package com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection

Interface Joinable<Value>

All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<Value>
All Known Subinterfaces:
Copyable<Value,Copy>, Indexable<Value>, Sectionable<Value,Section>, Sequence<Value>, WriteIndexable<Value>
public interface Joinable<Value> extends Iterable<Value>
An object that is Joinable is Iterable. Objects are iterated through and joined by separator values into a String.

Methods

  • join(char separator) - Returns a string where each value in this Iterable is separated from the next with the given separator
  • join(String separator) - Returns a string where each value in this Iterable is separated from the next with the given separator
  • joinOrDefault(String separator, String defaultValue) - Returns a string where each value in this Iterable is separated from the next with the given separator. If there are no values the default value is returned.
  • join(String separator, Function) - Returns a string where each value in this Iterable is separated from the next with the given separator. Each value is transformed into a string using the given function
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • join

      default String join(String separator, Function<Value,String> toString)
      Returns the values in this sequence transformed into strings by the given function and joined together with the given separator.
      Parameters:
      separator - The separator to put between values
      toString - The function to convert values into strings
      Returns:
      The joined string

    • joinOrDefault

      default String joinOrDefault(String separator, String defaultValue)
      Returns the values in this sequence joined as a string with the given separator or the default value if this sequence is empty.
      Parameters:
      separator - The separator to put between values
      defaultValue - The value to return if this joinable has nothing to join
      Returns:
      The joined values in this joinable, or the default value if there are none

      Returns the separator to use when joining
